slides.title: Why Study Databases?
slides.content:
• Datasets are continually increasing in diversity and volume
    • Digital Libraries, Skyserver, Twitter, Phone Sensors
  • Information is one of the most valuable resources in the modern age
    • Database Management Systems are everywhere
    • Search engines are ubiquitous
    • 100+ billion dollar a year industry
      (crucial knowledge in the job market)
  • Databases touch on many aspects of CS
    • OS, Programming Languages, ''A''I, Logic, ...

slides.title: What is a Database (or DBMS)?
slides.content:
• A very large, integrated collection of (curated?) data
  • A schema (or model) that dictates what kind of information appears in the data
    • Entities (e.g., Students, Companies, Captains, Planets)
    • Relationships (e.g., Captain Kirk visited Vulcan)
  • A Database Management System (DBMS) is a software package designed to store and manage databases

slides.title: Why use a DBMS?
slides.content:
• Rapid application development (through Queries)
  • Data Independence
  • Concurrent Access
  • Crash Recovery
  • Ease of Management
